title: Vehicle Accident
description: Rash driving or negligence causing hurt or death.
steps: Check for injuries and call ambulance (108) if needed.
Note down the vehicle number of the other party.
Take photos of the scene and damages.
File an FIR at the nearest police station.
Inform your insurance company immediately.
penalty: Imprisonment up to 6 months (279) or 2 years (304A) + Fine
time_limit: No specific limit for FIR, but immediate is best. Compensation claim: 6 months.

title: Theft of Mobile Phone
description: Theft of movable property.
steps: Block your SIM card immediately.
File an FIR or e-FIR online.
Register on CEIR portal (ceir.gov.in) to block the IMEI.
Keep a copy of the FIR for getting a duplicate SIM.
penalty: Imprisonment up to 3 years or fine or both
time_limit: No strict limit, but delay weakens case.

title: Domestic Violence
description: Cruelty by husband or relatives of husband.
steps: Call Women's Helpline 181 or Police 112.
Go to a safe place (parents' home or shelter).
File a complaint with the Protection Officer or Police.
Seek medical help if injured and keep reports.
time_limit: Limit varies, but 498A is a continuing offense.

title: Online Financial Fraud (UPI/Bank)
description: Cheating by personation using computer resource.
steps: Call 1930 (Cybercrime Helpline) immediately.
Report on cybercrime.gov.in.
Contact your bank to freeze the account/transaction.
Take screenshots of the transaction and messages.
penalty: Imprisonment up to 3 years (IT Act) / 7 years (420)
time_limit: Golden Hour: Report within 1 hour for best chance of recovery.

title: Stalking
description: Following a woman, contacting her despite disinterest, or monitoring use of internet.
steps: Do not engage with the stalker.
Keep a record of all interactions (calls, texts, logs).
File a complaint at the nearest police station or online.
Dial 1091 (Women Helpline) for assistance.
penalty: Imprisonment up to 3 years (1st offense) / 5 years (subsequent)

title: Cheque Bounce
description: Dishonour of cheque for insufficiency of funds.
steps: Collect the 'Cheque Return Memo' from the bank.
Send a Legal Notice to the drawer within 30 days.
If no payment in 15 days, file a case in court within 30 days.
Consult a lawyer.
penalty: Imprisonment up to 2 years or Fine (2x cheque amount)
time_limit: Strict timelines apply (30 days for notice, etc.).

title: Landlord Tenant Dispute (Eviction)
description: Illegal eviction or dispute over rent/property.
steps: Check your Rent Agreement terms.
Landlord cannot evict without due process/notice.
File a complaint with the Rent Controller.
Do not use force.

title: Medical Negligence
description: Death or injury caused by negligent act of medical professional.
steps: Secure all medical records and bills immediately.
Get an expert opinion if possible.
File a police complaint for criminal negligence.
File a case in Consumer Forum for compensation.

title: Defamation
description: Harming the reputation of a person.
steps: Save proofs of the defamatory statement (recording, screenshot).
Send a Legal Notice asking to withdraw/apologize.
File a criminal complaint in Magistrate court.
File a civil suit for damages.
penalty: Imprisonment up to 2 years or Fine

title: Consumer Complaint (Defective Product)
description: Sale of defective goods or deficiency in service.
steps: Complain to the seller/company customer care.
If unresolved, send a written notice.
File a complaint on National Consumer Helpline (1915).
File a case in District Consumer Commission.

title: Sexual Harassment at Workplace
description: Unwelcome acts or behavior of sexual nature at workplace.
steps: File a written complaint to the Internal Complaints Committee (ICC).
If no ICC, complain to Local Complaints Committee (LCC).
Can also file FIR under 354A.
Keep records of incidents.

title: Missing Child
description: Kidnapping or missing minor.
steps: Call 1098 (Childline) and Police 100/112 immediately.
File an FIR (Mandatory for missing child).
Upload details on TrackChild portal.
Search nearby areas and inform relatives.

title: Hit and Run
description: Accident where the vehicle does not stop.
steps: Note any details of the vehicle (color, make, part of number).
Call Police and Ambulance.
Look for CCTV cameras nearby.
Apply for Solatium Fund compensation.

title: Cyber Bullying
description: Bullying or harassment using electronic means.
steps: Block the user.
Report the content to the social media platform.
Take screenshots.
File a complaint at cybercrime.gov.in.

title: RTI Filing
description: Right to Information from public authority.
steps: Identify the Public Information Officer (PIO).
Write the application clearly specifying information needed.
Pay the fee (Rs. 10 usually).
Submit online (rtionline.gov.in) or via post.
time_limit: Reply must be given in 30 days.

title: Wrongful Termination
description: Termination without following due process or notice.
steps: Check your employment contract.
Send a formal grievance letter to HR.
File a dispute with the Labour Commissioner.
Send a Legal Notice.

title: Dowry Harassment
description: Harassment of woman for dowry.
steps: File a complaint with the Dowry Prohibition Officer.
File an FIR at the police station.
Secure your jewelry and stridhan.
Seek legal aid.
time_limit: No strict limit, but delay needs explanation.

title: Chain Snatching
description: Snatching property using criminal force.
steps: Raise an alarm immediately.
Note offender's description and vehicle.
File an FIR.

title: Passport Lost
description: Loss of Indian Passport.
steps: File a Police Complaint/Lost Report immediately.
Apply for re-issue on Passport Seva portal.
Submit the police report with application.
Inform embassy if lost abroad.
templates: Take screenshots of all threats and messages.
Report immediately on cybercrime.gov.in or call 1930.
File an FIR at the nearest police station or cyber cell.
evidence_required: Phone number/social media profile of blackmailer
Payment details if money was sent
Any images/videos shared (if safe to provide)
penalty: Imprisonment up to 10 years (384) + IT Act penalties
time_limit: Immediate reporting crucial. Do not delay.

title: Identity Theft
description: Using another person's identity for fraud or cheating.
steps: Collect evidence of misuse (fake accounts, fraudulent transactions).
Report to cybercrime.gov.in immediately.
File an FIR.
Report to UIDAI if Aadhar is misused.
File complaint with Income Tax if PAN is misused.
Alert your bank and freeze accounts if needed.
time_limit: Report immediately to prevent further misuse.

title: OTP Fraud
description: Fraudsters trick victims into sharing OTP to access bank accounts.
steps: Never share OTP with anyone, even if they claim to be from bank.
Call your bank immediately and block cards/accounts.
Call 1930 within 1 hour (Golden Hour).
Report on cybercrime.gov.in.
Take screenshots of SMS/calls.
File FIR if money was debited.
time_limit: Golden Hour: Report within 1 hour for recovery.

title: Social Media Account Hacking
description: Unauthorized access to social media or email accounts.
steps: Try to recover account using platform's recovery options.
Report the hack to the platform (Facebook/Instagram/etc.).
Change passwords of all linked accounts.
Alert friends/contacts about the hack.
If used for fraud/blackmail, report on cybercrime.gov.in.
File FIR if serious harm or financial loss.
penalty: Imprisonment up to 3 years + Fine (IT Act 66)

title: Fake Job Scam
description: Fraudsters offering fake jobs and demanding money for registration/training.
steps: Do not pay any more money.
Collect all communications (emails, messages, ads).
Report on cybercrime.gov.in.
File FIR mentioning cheating (IPC 420).
Report to job portal if ad was posted there.
time_limit: No strict limit. Report as soon as you realize.

title: Phishing Attack
description: Fake emails/messages pretending to be from banks/companies to steal credentials.
steps: Do not click on suspicious links.
Do not enter credentials on unknown websites.
Forward the phishing email/SMS to your bank.
If you already entered details, change passwords immediately.
Report on cybercrime.gov.in.
Alert bank if financial data was shared.

title: Property Encroachment
description: Illegal occupation or construction on another's property.
steps: Check your property documents and survey numbers.
Send a legal notice to the encroacher.
File a complaint with the Tahsildar/Revenue Officer.
File a case for trespass (441 IPC) if civil route fails.
Get a survey done to establish boundaries.

title: Builder Fraud / Construction Delay
description: Builder not delivering possession or violating agreement.
steps: Check your agreement for delay clauses.
Send a legal notice to the builder.
File a complaint with RERA Authority.
File a consumer complaint.
Join or form a buyer's association.

title: RERA Complaint
description: Violations under Real Estate Regulatory Authority.
steps: Collect all documents (Agreement, Receipts, etc.).
File a complaint on your State RERA website.
Pay the prescribed fee.
Attend hearings as per RERA schedule.
Can also file a consumer case parallelly.

title: PF/ESI Dispute
description: Employer not depositing PF/ESI or denying withdrawal.
steps: Check your PF account online (EPFO portal).
File a grievance on EPFO portal.
File a complaint with the Regional PF Commissioner.
Can approach Labour Court if unresolved.
For ESI, complain to ESI office.
time_limit: No strict limit, but early complaint better.

title: Workplace Discrimination
description: Discrimination based on caste, religion, gender, etc. at workplace.
steps: Document all instances of discrimination.
File a written complaint with HR or management.
If unresolved, complain to Labour Commissioner.
For SC/ST discrimination, file under SC/ST Act.
Can approach Human Rights Commission.
Consult a lawyer for legal recourse.

title: Divorce (Mutual Consent)
description: Divorce by mutual consent.
steps: Both parties must agree to divorce.
File a joint petition in Family Court.
1st motion hearing (cooling period of 6 months).
2nd motion hearing after 6 months.
Decree of divorce granted.
Consult a family lawyer.

title: Maintenance (125 CrPC)
description: Wife/child/parents can claim maintenance from husband/son.
steps: Assess your financial need and husband's income.
File a petition under Section 125 CrPC in Magistrate Court.
Submit evidence of marriage, income, need.
Court will determine maintenance amount.
Consult a lawyer.
time_limit: No limit, but delay affects interim relief.

title: Child Custody
description: Dispute over child custody after separation/divorce.
steps: Custody decisions prioritize child's welfare.
File a petition in Family Court or Civil Court.
Submit evidence of your ability to care for child.
Court may grant joint or sole custody.
Consult a family lawyer.

title: POCSO (Child Sexual Abuse)
description: Sexual offenses against children below 18 years.
steps: Call 1098 (Childline) or 112 immediately.
Take the child to a safe place.
File FIR at police station (Mandatory).
Medical examination will be arranged by police.
Special court handles POCSO cases.
Child Welfare Committee will be involved.

title: Outrage of Modesty (Molestation)
description: Assault or use of criminal force to outrage the modesty of a woman.
steps: Call 100/112 or Women Helpline 181 immediately.
File an FIR at the nearest police station.
Preserve evidence (torn clothes, injuries).
Get medical examination done.
Seek support from women's organizations.
time_limit: No limit, but immediate reporting advised.

title: Vehicle Theft
description: Theft of motor vehicle.
steps: File an FIR immediately at the nearest police station.
Note down vehicle details (number, chassis, engine number).
Inform your insurance company.
Check CCTV footage nearby.
Track using GPS if installed.
Keep checking vahan.parivahan.gov.in for vehicle status.

title: House Break-in / Burglary
description: House-breaking and theft.
steps: Do not touch anything - preserve the crime scene.
Call 100/112 immediately.
File an FIR.
Make a list of stolen items with approximate value.
Check for CCTV in building or nearby.
Inform neighbors to be alert.

title: FIR Copy Request
description: How to obtain a copy of your FIR.
steps: You are entitled to a free copy of the FIR.
Ask the police officer at the station where FIR was filed.
If denied, submit a written application to the Station House Officer (SHO).
You can also apply through RTI.
Online FIR copy can be downloaded from state police websites (if e-FIR).
time_limit: Usually given immediately. If not, RTI within 30 days.

title: Online Delivery Fraud
description: Not receiving ordered product or receiving wrong/damaged product.
steps: Contact customer care immediately and raise a complaint.
If unresolved, escalate to grievance officer.
File a complaint on National Consumer Helpline (1915).
Write a review on the platform.
If fraud, file on consumerhelpline.gov.in.
Can file in Consumer Forum for compensation.

title: Bank Account Fraud
description: Unauthorized transactions or access to bank account.
steps: Call bank customer care immediately and block card/account.
File a dispute with the bank.
Report to 1930 (Cybercrime Helpline).
File FIR if bank doesn't resolve.
Submit written complaint to bank manager.
Escalate to Banking Ombudsman if needed.
time_limit: Report within 24 hours for best chance.

title: Electricity Bill Dispute
description: Dispute over high or wrong electricity bill.
steps: Check if meter reading is correct.
File a complaint with the electricity board office.
Ask for meter testing.
If unresolved, file with Consumer Forum.
Keep records of previous bills for comparison.

title: Blackmail/Threatening
description: Threatening or blackmailing for money or other demands.
steps: Do not comply with demands.
Save all evidence (messages, calls, recordings).
File an FIR immediately.
For cyber blackmail, also report on cybercrime.gov.in.
Seek police protection if feeling threatened.

title: Neighbour Dispute
description: Disputes with neighbors over noise, property, or other issues.
steps: Try to resolve amicably first.
If noise pollution, complain to local police (especially after 10 PM).
For property dispute, consult a lawyer.
File a police complaint if harassment continues.
Can approach mediation centers.

title: Illegal Termination / Fired Without Notice
description: Termination without following due process or notice period.
steps: Check your employment contract for notice period clause.
Send a written grievance to HR/management.
File a complaint with Labour Commissioner.
Send a legal notice demanding notice pay.
Can approach Labour Court.

title: Salary Not Paid
description: Employer not paying salary on time or withholding wages.
steps: Send a written demand to employer (email/letter).
File a complaint with Labour Commissioner.
Can file a case under Payment of Wages Act.
For deliberate withholding, can file FIR under IPC 406 (Criminal Breach of Trust).
Consult a labour lawyer.

title: Ragging
description: Ragging in educational institutions.
steps: Report immediately to Anti-Ragging Committee of your institution.
Call UGC Anti-Ragging Helpline 1800-180-5522.
File a complaint on antiragging.in.
Can file FIR if physical/sexual harassment.
Parents can also complain.

title: False Accusation / Fake Case
description: Being falsely accused of a crime.
steps: Stay calm and do not panic.
Hire a criminal lawyer immediately.
Collect evidence proving your innocence.
Apply for anticipatory bail if arrest is likely.
After acquittal, can file a case for false accusation (IPC 211) or defamation.

title: Illegal Arrest / Police Harassment
description: Illegal arrest or harassment by police.
steps: Ask for the reason for arrest and show cause.
You have right to know charges and consult a lawyer.
Family must be informed within 12 hours.
Medical examination if tortured.
File a complaint with Senior Police Officer/Superintendent of Police.
Can approach Human Rights Commission.
File a writ in High Court.

title: Dowry Death
description: Death of a woman within 7 years of marriage due to dowry harassment.
steps: Call 100/112 or Women Helpline 181 immediately.
FIR is mandatory.
Post-mortem will be conducted.
Special investigation by police.
Family of deceased can engage a lawyer.
Compensation can be claimed.
penalty: Imprisonment minimum 7 years, up to life

title: Acid Attack
description: Throwing acid causing grievous hurt.
steps: Immediately wash with clean water for 15-20 minutes.
Call 108 (Ambulance) and 100/112 (Police).
Get emergency medical treatment.
FIR will be filed by police.
Government compensation available.
Free medical treatment under government schemes.
penalty: Imprisonment minimum 10 years, up to life

title: Online Harassment of Women
description: Online sexual harassment, unwanted messages, comments.
steps: Do not respond to the harasser.
Take screenshots immediately.
Block the person.
Report to the social media platform.
File a complaint on cybercrime.gov.in.
Can file FIR under 354A or IT Act.
Use 'She Box' portal for workplace-related harassment.
time_limit: No strict limit, but report quickly.

title: Kidnapping
description: Kidnapping or abduction of a person.
steps: Call 100/112 immediately.
File an FIR without delay.
For child, also call 1098.
Provide recent photo and description.
Check CCTV in the area.
Alert family and neighbors.
penalty: Imprisonment up to 10 years or life
